hanzi-su-wiki:
棟

Значения

Конёк крыши; счётный суффикс для домов

Мнемоника

Деревянные 木 потолочные балки, расположенные в китайском доме с запада на восток 東. В Японии — конёк крыши.

Варианты

栋
purpleculture_pinyin:
dòng
classifier for houses or buildings; ridgepole (old)
классификатор для домов или построек; хребет (старый)
rtega_mnemonic:
棟棟RS
栋栋		the main beams supporting a house, ridgepole, ridge
  • the main wooden 木 beams of a cathedral (oriented on the east 東) usually run from east 東 to west
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 栋)
Pictophonetic: 東 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 棟梁 [ dòng liáng ]: ridgepole; ridgepole and beams; person able to bear heavy responsibility; mainstay (of organization); pillar (of state)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 東 [ dōng ] east, eastern, eastward
heisig_chinese_memo: Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a building should be made of wood and face east.
heisig_constituent: ridgepole, tree, wood, east, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2
heisig_story: If the piece of wood in the roof known as the ridgepole points east, the sunrise will be visible from the front door.
koohiiStory1: Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a house should be made of wood and face east.
koohiiStory2: Ok just a note to the ´ridgepole facing east story´ im making up a story to JUSTIFY why that is the case. Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a ´sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is´, back in those days when people used ridgepoles they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There’s a tree in the east that looks like a pillar. The tree is tall and straight and does not have any leaves or branches. The tree is basically a big wooden pillar that just happens to be alive still.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at this big tree pillar over in the east. You always know where east is because of it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: That pillar happens to be in the center of とうきょう. If you need to find east (which is where とうきょう is), you just look for the pillar.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine looking down on とうきょう from atop this magnificent pillar. The sun is rising behind you, slowly illuminating the city below.
Ru_Russian:
гребень крыши, конёк
счётный суффикс для домов, а также секций многоквартирного дома, имеющих отдельную кровлю
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 陳 (ひねる、チン излагать, показывать).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 日 (день), 木 (дерево), 田 (рисовое поле)
Ru_trainchinese: dòng: (графема/сч.слово) (книжн.) коньковый брус; дом; счетное слово для зданий
Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the east (東) a tree (木) can be the ridge of a roof
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To make a building you need a minimum of some trees and a rickshaw to carry the wood back and forth.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " wood " to " east ", the original meaning is the beam of the house. "Shuowen": "Extremely also. From the wood, the east sound." "Yi·Xi Cixia": "The ancient cave dwelled but the wild place, the later saints changed the palace to the palace, and went up and down to wait for the wind and rain."

" Dong " can be compared to an important person. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language One": "Prince, the country's ridge."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and " east ", the original meaning is the beam of the house.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「東」聲，本義為屋的正梁。《說文》：「極也。从木，東聲。」《易‧繫辭下》：「上古穴居而野處，後世聖人易之以宮室，上棟下宇，以待風雨。」

　　「棟」可比喻重要的人。《國語‧晉語一》：「太子，國之棟也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「東」聲，本義為屋的正梁。

Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a ´sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is´, back in those days when people used ridgepoles they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning).

棟(とう): place, section, building

從「 木 」，「 東 」聲，本義為屋的正梁。《說文》：「極也。从木，東聲。」《易‧繫辭下》：「上古穴居而野處，後世聖人易之以宮室，上棟下宇，以待風雨。」 「 棟 」可比喻重要的人。《國語‧晉語一》：「太子，國之棟也。」
From the sound of " wood" to " east", the original meaning is the beam of the house. "Shuowen": "Extremely also. From the wood, the east sound." "Yi·Xi Cixia": "The ancient cave dwelled but the wild place, the later saints changed the palace to the palace, and went up and down to wait for the wind and rain." " Dong" can be compared to an important person. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language One": "Prince, the country's ridge."

棟字的基本解释

棟
dòng
见“栋”。

棟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dòng］
［《廣韻》多貢切，去送，端。］
“栋1”的繁体字。
(1)屋的正梁。
(2)比喻重要的人。
(3)量词。房屋一座叫一栋。
(4)方言。山岭。
(5)星名。参见“棟星”。
(6)姓。明有栋成。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dòng］
["Guangyun" Dogon cut, go to send, end. ]
Traditional characters for "栋1".
(1) The front beam of the house.
(2) An analogy of important people.
(3) Quantifiers. One house is called one house.
(4) Dialects. Mountains.
(5) Star name. See "Dongxing".
(6) Last name. Ming You Dongcheng.

dòng
вм. 栋
Radicals: 木, 東  (tree, east)
Meaning Mnemonic
There’s a tree in the east that looks like a pillar. The tree is tall and straight and does not have any leaves or branches. The tree is basically a big wooden pillar that just happens to be alive still.
Look at this big tree pillar over in the east. You always know where east is because of it.
Reading Mnemonic
That pillar happens to be in the center of とうきょう. If you need to find east (which is where とうきょう is), you just look for the pillar.
Imagine looking down on とうきょう from atop this magnificent pillar. The sun is rising behind you, slowly illuminating the city below.
